results.name: "Sloping binary representation" of powers of 3 (A000244), slope = -1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
example: When powers of 3 are written in binary (see A004656), under each other as:

and one collects their bits from the column-0 to NW-direction (from the least to the most significant end), one gets 1 (1), 01 (1), 011 (3), 0001 (1), 00011 (3), 001001 (9), etc. (See A105033 for similar transformation done on nonnegative integers, A001477).
program: BINSLOPE(f) = n -> sum(i=0,n,bitand(2^(n-i),f(i))); \\ General transformation for these kinds of sequences.
A037095 = BINSLOPE(n -> 3^n); \\ And its application to A000244. - _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 09 2020
